title: Why We Fight: Prelude to War
creator_credit: War Activities Committee of the Motion Pictures Industry, Frank Capra, Eric Knight, Anatole Litvak and Anthony Veiller
brief_description: Prelude to War was the first film of Frank Capra’s Why We Fight propaganda film series, commissioned by the Pentagon and George C. Marshall. It was made to convince American troops of the necessity of combating the Axis Powers during World War II. This film examines the differences between democratic and fascist states.

constellations_other.name: The war effort on film
constellations_other.description: Newsreel and documentaries were used as propaganda for the war effort by all sides during WWII, many of them made by major film studios, directors and actors.
